oai_dc:dc.dc:title: C.C.C. workers from Co. 1473, Camp Evan Shelby, work splitting logs

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group of Civilian Conservation Corps men from Company 1473 work in rural East Tennessee at Camp Evan Shelby, Bristol, Tennessee, with logs of various sizes in 1933.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
